newsitem.title: ESTONIA: INDUSTRIAL PRODUCTION UP 1.3 PCT IN 1996.
newsitem.headline: INDUSTRIAL PRODUCTION UP 1.3 PCT IN 1996.

text.p: Estonia's industrial production increased by 1.3 percent during last year according to preliminary data, the statistics office said on Tuesday.
In the last quarter of 1996, industrial production rose by 3.4 percent, the office said in a statement.
The office said that manufacturing output fell 0.1 percent in 1996 due to a fall during the first two quarters of the year.

In the final quarter, manufacturing rose by 4.3 percent compared to the same period in 1996, food production fell five percent due to a fall in meat production, textiles output rose 15.2 percent, timber output rose 46.6 percent and plastics production rose 32.5 percent.
The statistics office did not give any figures for the size of the sectors.
-- Eva Palu, Tallinn newsroom +372 630 8400, reuters@reuters.ee last year
